visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing categorical comparisons between weather conditions using relative scaling for typography and line elements

subtitle.text: Use the slider below the chart to set top-level font size

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two categorical series comparing four weather conditions (Rain, Snow, Sun, Wind) across two measurement dimensions. X-axis categories represent discrete meteorological phenomena while y-axis values show quantitative measurements. Original data preserves ratio scaling with Series 2 values consistently higher than Series 1 across all categories. Column chart selection optimizes data-ink ratio by directly encoding values through column heights while eliminating redundant gridlines. Color contrast between series follows Cairo's salience principles for immediate differentiation. Relative font sizing (title: 1.2em, labels: 1em, subtitle: 0.9em) maintains hierarchical relationships while enabling proportional scaling through CSS controls. Zero border width and controlled padding maximize data-ink while preventing visual clutter.
